overview_of_class: This course will survey central topics in microeconomic theory that are typically not reached in Economics 310-1. Among the topics covered are: social choice theory, general equilibrium in perfectly competitive markets, game theory, imperfectly competitive markets. adverse selection and moral hazard.
name: Microeconomics
title: WCAS ECON 310-2-20 Microeconomics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will survey central topics in microeconomic theory that are typically not reached in Economics 310-1. Among the topics covered are: social choice theory, general equilibrium in perfectly competitive markets, game theory, imperfectly competitive markets. adverse selection and moral hazard.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Econ 310-1, Math 214-1 and 2 or their equivalent.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minute lectures and a 1-hour discussion section per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Biweekly homeworks, two midterms and one final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: There is no required textbook for the course. Most textbooks at intermediate level offer some coverage of some of the topics in the course. However, the lectures will typically explore the topics in greater depth. The lecture notes will be posted online, usually a week in advance. A small number of topics will be covered as in textbooks, and the daily schedule of the course provides the sources that will be used in such cases.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: David Besanko and Ronald Braeutigam - "Microeconomics: An Integrated Approach", 4th Edition (ISBN: 978-0470563588)

subject: ECON
